comments.body: It's the exits() that are nasty, but I don't think I can call the generators directly anymore (with next()) as it appears they're munged by @contextmanager.

diffHunk:

        self.stdout_swap_ctx.__exit__(None, None, None)

    def test_exit_json_no_args_exits(self):
        with self.assertRaises(SystemExit) as ctx:

comments.body: This isn't _horrible_, but again, non-obvious- not sure if this is better or worse than overriding run().
